title: [BUG] Benchmark of HC2 and HC1 do not match paper results
body:
Hi, 

I'm currently running experiments and benchmarking the performance of multiple algorithms used in the SoTA of TSC. During those experiments, i'm consistently getting the results that HC2 is slower than HC1 (using default parameters for both), which contradict the results given in the paper presenting HC2. That is, trying on multiple datasets, with and without using n_jobs>1.

Is this an expected behavior due to some work in progress or something wrong on my side ?

Example results on the Crop dataset with varying number of samples:

|n_samples|RDST              |Rocket            |DrCIF             |HC1              |HC2               |STC              |RDST_std            |Rocket_std          |DrCIF_std         |HC1_std           |STC_std            |HC2_std           |
|------|------------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------|------------------|-----------------|--------------------|--------------------|------------------|------------------|-------------------|------------------|
|225   |0.8935474371537566|0.4801460364833474|18.577583170495927|7848.464765178971|8959.079658895731 |86.56675709038973|0.04171504359692335 |0.010750255547463894|0.3076158696785569|4.683004071004689 |0.43590452894568443|25.00064292922616 |
|450   |1.6947628241032362|0.8065409753471613|24.938918606378138|8360.594130783342|10547.514885107055|243.3796755867079|0.02757885307073593 |0.055771343410015106|0.2900445992127061|18.76490328181535 |1.9626950984820724 |43.63670677691698 |
|675   |2.320853997953236 |0.9106023721396923|44.63115615211427 |8971.236895166337|12217.335100212134|430.5591306462884|0.028325325809419155|0.008519411087036133|1.7223147563636303|35.296641977503896|0.5699807498604059 |29.104480856098235|


The code used to produce my benchmark can be found here :
https://github.com/baraline/convst/blob/main/PaperScripts/benchmark.py

The system i'm running the experiments on :
DELL PowerEdge R730 on Debian 9 with 2 XEON E5-2630 Corei7 (92 cores) and 64GB of RAM

Sktime version : 0.10.1
